H6290.def: = desert; ◄ located south of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, west of {L:Edom<SDBH:אֱדֹום>} and north of {L:Sinai<SDBH:סִינַי>} desert

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H4714.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as founder of the {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} nation

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H40.def: = name or title of man; ► king of {L:Gerar<SDBH:גְּרָר>}

H6369.def: = man; ► commander of army of {L:Abimelech<SDBH:אֲבִימֶלֶךְ>}, king of {L:Philistines<SDBH:פְּלִשְׁתִּי>}

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H85.def: = man, also known as {L:Abram<SDBH:אַבְרָם>}; ◄ son of {L:Terah<SDBH:תֶּרַח>}; ► first patriarch of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; father of {L:Ishmael<SDBH:יִשְׁמָעֵאל>} and {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H7650.def: = action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H8266.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H1481.def: = state in which humans live in a place that is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H85.def: = man, also known as {L:Abram<SDBH:אַבְרָם>}; ◄ son of {L:Terah<SDBH:תֶּרַח>}; ► first patriarch of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; father of {L:Ishmael<SDBH:יִשְׁמָעֵאל>} and {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}

H7650.def: = action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3198.def: = action by which someone with judicial authority settles a dispute between two parties

H40.def: = name or title of man; ► king of {L:Gerar<SDBH:גְּרָר>}

H182.def: marker that introduces an object or event that is regarded as directly or indirectly responsible for the event in focus

H875.def: = hole in the ground that reaches underground water; ◄  usually manmade, dug out of the ground, or hewn from rock, but may also be naturally-occurring; ► used for accessing, collecting and storing water; used by shepherds as a source of water for their animals; ≈ regarded  as a source of life because of its water; sometimes used as a metaphor for a woman, possibly based on the physical resemblance of the well to the vagina and its connotation as a source of life

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H1497.def: = action by which humans take property unlawfully from a person or place, usually by force or threat of force

H40.def: = name or title of man; ► king of {L:Gerar<SDBH:גְּרָר>}

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H1241.def: = large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, ► chiefly domesticated for meat or milk, as beasts of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; it is a clean animal and can be eaten and sacrificed; ≈ regarded as a sign of wealth

H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H5324.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals place themselves in a certain location in an upright position

H905.def: = woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of clothes; worn by priests and supernatural beings; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness

H7651.def: = state in which a countable entity is seven in number

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H2658.def: = action by which animals strike the ground with their feet

H875.def: = hole in the ground that reaches underground water; ◄  usually manmade, dug out of the ground, or hewn from rock, but may also be naturally-occurring; ► used for accessing, collecting and storing water; used by shepherds as a source of water for their animals; ≈ regarded  as a source of life because of its water; sometimes used as a metaphor for a woman, possibly based on the physical resemblance of the well to the vagina and its connotation as a source of life

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H5193.def: = action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors

H815.def: = small, fast-growing tree, about 10 m. high, to be found abundantly in deserts, dunes, and salt marshes; leafless, has green branches, and a wide crown; this tree has small white flowers, and its fruit is a capsule with feathery seeds; ◄ |itamarix aphylla|i*; ► has durable wood; ≈ could have a link with cultic worship

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
